name: "Sly 2" - "He Who Tames the Iron Horse" (PS2) Online Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: The location of the game used to be a popular spot for what kind of tourists?
questions.explanation:
Rock Climbers.

	During a scene, Bentley tells you the old wall hooks you find around were once used by rock climbers.  They are the leftover hooks the climbers did not dislodge from the ice.

questions.text: What is the title of the very first mission?
questions.explanation:
Cabin Crimes.

	The level begins in Jean Bison's cabin.  You must take reconnaissance photos of the three routes the Iron Horses take.  While you are doing this, you overhear where Jean Bison hides the blueprints.  They are in fishes mouths about the three cabin mantles, so you must get those, too, during this mission.

questions.text: Where is the vault located in this level?
questions.correct: The cabin on the far left from the Safehouse
options: The cabin on the far right from the Safehouse
Jean Bison's cabin; the middle one
questions.explanation:
The cabin on the far left from the Safehouse.

	The vault is located in the cabin to the far left.  You get the music box with this one.  The combination is 129.  Don't worry if you don't have all the bottles.  Like all the other vaults, you can come back to the room whenever you want.

questions.text: What is the name of the second cabin you enter?
questions.explanation:
Ponderosa Cabin.

	It does not matter what order you use to enter the cabins.  The mission starts in Jean Bison's cabin, and the second one is the Ponderosa Cabin, no matter what.  You can hear Jean Bison say the name of the cabin when he is telling the other cabin to be on the lookout for Sly, although Jean Bison does not know it is Sly who stole the blueprints. The Ponderosa Cabin is far easier than the next one, as the only guards are birds, some being in the rafters.  If you get caught, you can fight them off.  The next one is much harder, because if you get caught, you can't fight off the four flashlight guards!

questions.text: What does Jean Bison want to buy from Arpeggio?
questions.explanation:
The Clockwerk Brain.

	You can hear Jean Bison talking on the phone with Arpeggio while you steal the blueprints after taking recon photos.  Arpeggio says it is hidden on his blimp.  Jean Bison wants to buy it, or at least look at it, but Arpeggio doesn't want him to even look at it.

questions.text: How was Carmelita able to capture Murray?
options: None of these; she caught Sly
questions.explanation:
He was out alone.

	Murray was hungry, so he went out of the Safehouse looking for a snack.  This causes Bentley to be very worried.  He has no idea where Murray is, or what Carmelita has done to him.

questions.text: What kind of gas in the balloons?
questions.explanation:
Spice gas.

	The spice gas is very unstable, so if you hit the ground with it you will blow up.  The gas is used to blow off the locks on the trains.  You wear a vacuum pack which sucks in the gas as soon as you pop a balloon.  Since the gas is lighter than air, you bounce very high when you hit a balloon.  This mission uses the paraglide.

questions.text: Which Clockwerk part do you steal first?
questions.explanation:
Right lung.

	You begin by stealing the right lung, which Bentley does.  He begins stealing the lung, and Sly steals the other two.  After stealing the right lung, you steal the left lung, and finally steal the stomach.

questions.text: Which of these missions did Bentley begin?
questions.explanation:
Ride the Iron Horse.

	Bentley begins the mission "Ride the Iron Horse," which is where you get the right lung.  Sly does the mission "Theft on the Rails," where you get the left lung.  The final train is going too fast, so there is much more involved than jumping on.  Getting the Clockwerk stomach is the final operation.

questions.text: What is the final operation's name?
questions.explanation:
Operation: Choo-Choo.

	Murray begins "Operation: Choo-Choo."  He must capture two bear cubs and throw them over a fence with an old train cart.  After doing this, you ride the cart, and Sly and Bentley jump on the train.  Sly goes after the Clockwerk stomach while Bentley provides aerial help.  Neyla comes wanting to take the stomach, and she is in a plane.  She is the main bad guy of this level, fought by Bentley's RC Chopper.
